newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore property shares kick up, trade data eyed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore property shares kick up, trade data eyed.

text.p: Singapore property stocks kicked up in early trade on Tuesday following changes to public housing sector policies.
"The impact on property stocks is positive as it would encourage upgraders to opt for private property," said a dealer.
Among the new rules announced by the Housing Development Board (HDB) on Sunday were a 10-year waiting period for a second HDB flat instead of five and a hike in resale levies.
But dealers said it was too early to tell what the combined impact of various measures, introduced by the government over the past year to curb speculation, would be.
The property index rose 5.39 points to 683.06 at 0216 GMT with City Development and DBS Land up Singapore $0.10 each.
Dealers said the rest of the market was quiet as investors awaited the release of Singapore's April non-oil domestic export data at noon.
The Straits Times Industrials Index inched up 5.14 points to 2,056.08.

Expectations of whether the U.S. Federal Reserve would hike rates later in the day were mixed. Various block trades were seen in Singapore Telecom, Fraser & Neave and Natsteel. --Josephine Ng (65-8703094)
